data.title: Fayetteville State University Athletics
data.meta_description: The official Hall of Fame for the Fayetteville State University  Broncos
data.text:
Hall of Fame

FAYETTEVILLE STATE UNIVERSITY ATHLETICS HALL OF FAME

The purpose of the Athletics Hall of Fame is to recognize and honor individuals who achieved excellence by participating in intercollegiate athletics at Fayetteville State University (FSU) or who as a coach, administrator or special individual made demonstrably outstanding and significant contributions to FSUâ€™s athletics program.

A student-athlete who has competed for FSU is eligible for consideration, provided that five (5) years have passed since the completion of his or her eligibility. A Coach who has served at FSU for at least five (5) years is eligible for election into the Hall of Fame. A team must have won a National Championship or CIAA championship. Any individual, living or deceased, who has made unique and extraordinary contributions to the FSU athletics program, may be eligible for election as a Special Inductee. For more information on the Hall of Fame process and bylaws, click HERE

Nominations are accepted until July 1 of each year. Click HERE to access the nomination form.
